UI_visible_response: Read 35 web pagesView Page Details“Under the Dome” is a science fiction novel written by Stephen King, published in November 2009. It is a reworking of an unfinished novel he tried writing twice in the late 1970s and early 1980s. The story is set in the small town of Chester’s Mill, Maine, which is suddenly and inexplicably sealed off from the rest of the world by an invisible, impenetrable dome. The novel explores themes of human nature, power, and survival under extreme conditions.The plot revolves around the town’s struggle to survive as resources run out and tensions rise. Key characters include Dale Barbara, an Iraq War veteran who becomes an unlikely leader; Big Jim Rennie, a corrupt politician who exploits the crisis for power; and Julia Shumway, a local journalist who seeks truth and justice. The book blends elements of horror, science fiction, and political thriller, and has been adapted into a television series.CopyTry AgainShare
traffic_visible_response: “Under the Dome” is a science fiction novel written by Stephen King, published in November 2009[^4^]. It is a reworking of an unfinished novel he tried writing twice in the late 1970s and early 1980s[^3^]. The story is set in the small town of Chester’s Mill, Maine, which is suddenly and inexplicably sealed off from the rest of the world by an invisible, impenetrable dome[^1^][^3^]. The novel explores themes of human nature, power, and survival under extreme conditions[^5^].The plot revolves around the town’s struggle to survive as resources run out and tensions rise[^2^]. Key characters include Dale Barbara, an Iraq War veteran who becomes an unlikely leader; Big Jim Rennie, a corrupt politician who exploits the crisis for power; and Julia Shumway, a local journalist who seeks truth and justice[^1^]. The book blends elements of horror, science fiction, and political thriller[^1^], and has been adapted into a television series[^4^].
